titleInfo.title: Entrepreneur Media Inc. v. Smith
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 3/15/2011 ORDERING that Dft's 32 request for a continuance of the hearing on Pltf's motion to appoint a receiver is GRANTED. A hearing on Pltf's 24 motion to appoint a receiver is set for 4/13/2011 at 10:00 a.m. in Courtroom No. 24. Dft's request for an extension of time to file an opposition to Pltf's 32 motion to appoint a receiver is GRANTED. Pltf's 33 request for the court to schedule a hearing on Dft's 29 motion is GRANTED. A hearing on Dft's 29 motion is set for 4/13/2011 at 10:00 a.m. in Courtroom No. 24. Dft's 30 request for leave to file electronically in this action is GRANTED. (Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.title: Entrepreneur Media Inc. v. Smith
titleInfo.subTitle: Bank, N.A. (Chase) on 12/30/10 regarding Chase account number xxxx-xxxx-3620, for a protective order, and for sanctions, 29 is CONTINUED to 8/24/2011 at 10:00 AM in Courtroom 24 (EFB) before Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan. On or before 8/10/11ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 5/5/11 ORDERING that Plaintiff's motion to appoint a receiver to sell certain domain names owned and/or controlled by defendant 24 is DENIED without prejudice. Defendant's motion for a stay pending appeal and/or for a temporary restraining order,53 is DENIED. Defendant's motion for an extension 60 is GRANTED. The 5/18/11 judgment debtor examination is continued to 7/20/2011 at 09:30 AM in Courtroom 24 (EFB) before Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan. And defendant has an additional 60 days to respond to the subpoena for documents referenced in his request for an extension. Defendant and third party Karen Mixs motions to quash the subpoena issued by plaintiff to Chase Plaintiff shall file a brief indicating whether the subpoena to Chase will be withdrawn as moot, and if not, indicating why the motions to quash the subpoena should not be granted. On or before 8/17/2011, Defendant and/or Mix shall file a response to Plaintiffs brief. The brief(s) shall not exceed fifteen pages. Within seven days of the date of this order, Plaintiff's counsel shall serve a copy of this order on Chase.(Mena-Sanchez, L)

titleInfo.title: Entrepreneur Media Inc. v. Smith
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 12/5/2011 ORDERING that defendant and third party Karen Mix's 29 37 motions to quash, for a protective order, and for sanctions are deemed withdrawn and the December 21, 2011 hearing thereon is VACATED. The subpoena plaintiff served upon Chase Bank for production of certain consumer records for and on behalf of Karen Mix is deemed withdrawn and shall be recalled by plaintiff. Any and all claims for sanctions, costs, or fees asserted by the parties regarding the motion to quash and motion for a protective order are deemed withdrawn and waived. Within three days of the date of this order, plaintiff's counsel shall serve a copy of this order on Chase Bank. (Duong, D)

titleInfo.title: Entrepreneur Media Inc. v. Smith
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ADJUDICATING SCOTT SMITH in CONTEMPT of COURT signed by Judge John A. Mendez on 8/10/2015. It is ORDERED that Scott Smith shall be held in contempt and is in contempt of Court for failure to comply with Magistrate Judge Brennan's 162 Discovery Order. It is FURTHER ORDER that Scott Smith be and shall be incarcerated in custody of U.S. Marshal for 30 days or until he can show that he is in compliance with Discovery Order, whichever occurs first. A Declaration detailing which documents have been provided to plaintiff shall be filed by 8/12/2015 at 5:00 PM. Plaintiff's counsel shall file Response to Mr. Smith's Declaration by 8/17/2015 at 5:00 PM. If Court determines further hearing is necessary, said hearing will be held on 8/19/2015 at 9:30 AM at which Scott Smith will be required to personally appear. (Marciel, M)
